availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George O. Hart (New Albany, Indiana Steamboat Captain)

body.p: New Albany, Indiana, druggist, steamboat captain, and merchant. Girard, Pennsylvania native. Son of Edson Hart and Hellen Hart. Married to Addie H. Stout on March 13, 1855. Father of George B. Hart, Addie Hart, Annie Hart, Lenah Hart, Archer H. Hart, Mary D. Hart, and Edson Hart. Clerk in New Albany in 1850. Druggist in New Albany in 1860. Captain of the Steamer St. Patrick on the Louisville, Cairo, and Memphis U.S. mail line, in 1864-1866.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Floyd County, New Albany, 327A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Floyd County, New Albany Ward 1, p. 128.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, Paducah Subdivision 112, p. 173B.
Find A Grave, "Capt George O Hart (1834-1906)," Memorial #84128963, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/84128963# (accessed June 8, 2018).
